title: Valentine single-page neon hearts surprise (iPad Chrome compatible)

requirements.summary: Render a single-page Valentine prompt for Shivani with exactly two choices labeled "yess" and "i dont like you".
acceptanceCriteria: The initial screen shows the name "Shivani," and the question "Will you be my Valentine?"
Exactly two interactive buttons are visible: "yess" and "i dont like you"
The page remains a single-screen/single-purpose flow (no extra navigation or features)

file_operations.description: Ensure the prompt text matches exactly (including the intended line break between "Shivani," and "Will you be my Valentine?") and ensure the two visible button labels are exactly "yess" and "i dont like you" (remove any extra emoji/words), keeping the experience as a single-screen flow without adding navigation.

requirements.summary: Provide a smooth full-viewport animated neon pink/white outlined (hollow) hearts background that floats upward continuously behind the content.
acceptanceCriteria: The heart shapes are visually hollow/outlined (stroke-based), not solid-filled
Hearts continuously spawn/loop from bottom-to-top and cover the full viewport behind the content
The color scheme uses pink/white neon styling with a visible glow effect
Animation runs smoothly on iPad Chrome at typical screen sizes

file_operations.description: Update the canvas renderer to draw hollow/outlined heart shapes (stroke-based) with a pink/white neon glow effect; increase/scale heart spawning to cover the full viewport and loop bottom-to-top continuously; optimize the animation loop for smooth iPad Chrome performance (e.g., reuse objects, minimize per-frame allocations).

requirements.summary: Add pointer/touch interactivity so nearby hearts react to user input while continuing to float upward.
acceptanceCriteria: Moving the pointer on desktop causes a visible local effect on nearby hearts
Touching/dragging on iPad causes a similar visible local effect on nearby hearts
Interactivity does not break the continuous upward floating behavior

file_operations.description: Add unified pointer/touch tracking (mouse move + touch/drag via pointer events) and apply a gentle local effect on nearby hearts (e.g., repulsion/drift and/or glow/intensity change) while preserving the continuous upward floating motion.

requirements.summary: Make the "i dont like you" button reliably evade hover and attempted tap/press by moving within the viewport and away from the main "yess" area.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: moving the cursor onto the "i dont like you" button causes it to relocate before it can be clicked
On iPad/touch: attempting to press/tap the "i dont like you" button triggers relocation instead of activation
The relocated position remains fully within the viewport bounds (not off-screen)
The evasive behavior remains reliable across repeated attempts

file_operations.description: Enhance the evasive positioning logic to guarantee the button stays fully within the viewport and avoids overlapping a provided "safe zone" rectangle (the "yess" button area, with padding), while remaining reliable across repeated attempts.

Wire the evasive behavior so "i dont like you" relocates on desktop hover and touch/press attempts using pointer-safe handlers, and pass the measured "yess" button area as the avoidance/safe-zone for the evasive positioning logic.
